To celebrate the introduction of the Bandelier National Park and Preserve bill, I'd like to see your own experiences in this living cultural landscape. Share your photos of Bandelier by tagging me and using the hashtag #BandelierNP! pic.twitter.com/cVz9bDorNo

This legislation has garnered widespread support from local communities throughout northern New Mexico and tribes across Indian Country. I look forward to working with all New Mexicans to establish Bandelier as our newest, and northern New Mexico‚Äôs first national park.

Creating this new national park is the best way to ensure Bandelier‚Äôs cultural treasures and northern New Mexico‚Äôs history and natural beauty receive the recognition and protection they have long deserved.
Bandelier‚Äôs mesas and canyons have human history that dates back more than 10,000 years. The ancestral sites in Bandelier continue to hold deep cultural and religious significance to the pueblos.

Only Congress can create a national park and provide the highest level of protection for cultural resources.
 
It's long past time that we recognize that Bandelier‚Äôs historical and natural resources are more than worthy of the protections national park status has to offer.

When I talk to people about what makes New Mexico unique, it always comes back to our breathtaking landscapes, complex history, and unique cultures.
 
That‚Äôs why I am so proud to introduce legislation today to make Bandelier our nation‚Äôs newest national park.

My bipartisan legislation, the STOP Act, would prohibit the exporting of sacred Native American items like the Acoma shield. No matter where they are, all sacred and culturally significant items must be returned to their rightful home.
